website_summaries.verdict: Low price for a touch mouse. Wedge design will be comfortable for quite a few users.
pros: Will work with most models of tablets and laptops successfully
Works equally well for left- or right-handed users
Provides a Bluetooth connectivity, rather than using a transceiver that you'd plug into the computer
Extremely small, so it's easy to take with you anywhere
cons: Battery compartment will seem loose with some models

website_summaries.verdict: Executives dying for an ultraportable mouse to go with their Windows 8 or Android tablet will find a beautiful companion in the Wedge Touch Mouse, but it's a lot to pay for a pretty basic set of functions.
pros: The Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse has an elegant, extremely compact, and surprisingly usable design, and works as well as advertised
cons: Touch gestures are limited to basic one-finger four-way scrolling, and a $70 price tag feels too lofty

customer_reviews.title: A tiny work of art
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Good, solid connection at all times. Feels good in your hand, and I rarely notice how tiny it is, from a comfort perspective. Just two examples of the attention to detail - the matte black surface has the precisely right amount of friction to it. And the battery compartment opens with an almost hypnotic precision. This is the travel mouse equivalent of a fine swiss watch.
customer_reviews.author: David Z. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Style
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Bluetooth mouse and liked the look of this one. It is of great quality and unusual for sure. I've had many inquiries as to 'what is that?'. I find it very comfortable with little to no stress on my wrist. It connected easily and glides with ease. I have to remember to power it off otherwise, the battery doesn't last long. It only takes one (1) AA battery. Don't use cheap batteries as they will not last long. I love the Wedge Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Swtn3ss

customer_reviews.title: Just wish it had a real right click button.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is pretty small. Which is a good thing. I like that part. It is not meant to be used as a daily mouse. Your hand will feel it. But if you need something for on-the-go, then this works pretty well, since you don't need to take up space for your USB port. Pros: *small *lightweight *works well on many surfaces Cons: *extended use might cramp hand *No right click button, it is touch sensitive, so if you want light gaming I recommend you get something else Overall a decent mouse. I would give 5 stars if it came with a dedicated right click button. Would I buy it again? Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Loved this mouse, super portable, some battery issues
customer_reviews.text: This mouse takes some getting used to, but I loved it and used it for a few years before switching to a Logitech mouse. Overall, it's very portable, comfortable once you get used to it, and is fairly responsive. The only issue I had over the years was that it ate up battery (single AA) life in what seemed like a short amount of time (a month or two), and it had issues recognizing the battery at times. It seemingly would shut off, I think the connection with the battery top was too loose. Overall, I liked this mouse and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bieger

customer_reviews.title: Neat but need power.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today (3/9/2016), if no update it means it works fine. Impressive little mouse, works with Lumia 950 XL and Continuum. I admit scrolling is not as good as I imaged it would, and it does requires plenty of battery power. I tested with one year old Eneloop Pro (basically the best rechargeable AA battery you can get). When mymouse from Logitech still says it has two bars, I put that battery into the Wedge and Wedge refuse to work. It does works with freshly charged Ni-MH rechargeable batteries, haven't done endurance test yet. Will update if this thing is thirsty like a cow.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: inferior tracking
customer_reviews.text: i had a lot of trouble with this mouse. its very small, not really very comfortable, eats batteries, and poor tracking. It was jerky and cut in and out. But the worst was that sometimes I had to literally bang on it to get it to "click". It often took two or three hard hits before it would work, and so I gave up on it. I was changing the battery almost once a week. Maybe it was a dud, don't know. It comes in a cool box - that's the only good thing I can say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina P

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse Is Super!
customer_reviews.text: I used this superb tiny Bluetooth mouse with my 11 inch Dell Windows 10 tablet. The mouse "pairs" easily, works great, is very strong and sturdy and fits into my small tablet carry bag. Doesn't get any better than that. BUT... after about 5 weeks this mouse became unstable with seemingly intermittent power issues with the battery. There is no "pressure spring" contact on the negative side of the battery and it's like this mouse can't maintain constant 100% connectivity with the battery. I stopped using this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: suzukiman

customer_reviews.title: A Winner from Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. While it is small, it feels good in my hand, and I can palm a basketball. The mouse has a nice heft to it -- it isn't made entirely of plastic. I've found the tracking to be on target, and the clicking and scrolling behavior to be intuitive. It is surprising that something this well-constructed and this good is this inexpensive. The mouse comes in Microsoft's attempt at Apple packaging, but this product really deserves special packaging. This mouse has been a great find.
customer_reviews.author: R. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works great but needs a driver for windows 7
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully! Excellent that it can scroll up and down and sideways! Compact and incredibly comfortable for its size. Has an off/on button to save battery life, so the battery lasts a long time. Great for travel, I keep it with my portable. Would strongly recommend. However, if you are using an earlier version of Windows (windows 7 etc.), you need to download a driver to get it to work. Otherwise the device will not recognize the mouse. Works automatically with windows 8 devices. This might not matter soon with the new windows 10 updates, guessing the driver will be included in the updates. Took a while to find the driver for my windows 7 device. Here is a link:
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my IPad. Works reasonably well within the limits of the IPad. Horizontal swipe doesn’t work on ipad but generally small and functional enough. The mouse doesn’t work on glass as I expected. Not sure if this is an issue due to iPad limitations. If you are looking at this for using with the IPad, there are better options available, albeit does not have the advantage of the wedge mouse’s small foot print.
customer_reviews.author: Rivi W.

customer_reviews.title: BLUETOOTH CORDLESS, NO USB PORT REQUIRED, USE IT ANYWHERE - ON OR OFF A DESKTOP.
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as any other mouse on a table top, but excels on your leg or your chair's soft arm rest. Can be used anywhere, like a standard mouse or like a touch pad, with page-down or page-over capabilities, but with no moving wheel or other parts. Takes a standard battery and shuts off automatically. This blue-tooth device has a quick one-button activation when needed. It is one of the few cordless units that requires no dongle to tie up a USB port. I use it with my Microsoft Surface Pro. A great unit at good price, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Addictive
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse, the bluetooth connection to non Microsoft computers seems to have been improved (it used to cut off all the time - I now have a Lenovo which might be a reason). I buy extras just so I never run the risk of not having one. Battery life can be a little short, so I carry extra batteries. Works great, great for travel and working in tight spaces, super functionality.
customer_reviews.author: mark b hosbein

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does not work, although you might be lucky on certain days when there is full moon and Microsoft stock is up. If you don't believe me, search the Internet and count the complaints about the reliability of this device.
customer_reviews.author: George Blaszczynski

customer_reviews.title: Lasts three years; my favorite mouse for Surface Pro 1 and 4
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in 2013 and it lasted for 3 years. I bought another one in 2016 and it lasted for three more years. That’s $90 total for 6 years, or $15/yr. They both worked great—for 3 years. I took a look at the new arch mouse ($78 at the Microsoft store), which is the replacement for the wedge mouse. It has up-down/side-side capability, the box says, but they hadn’t configured it, apparently, because the side to side feature didn’t work. If I can find a new wedge mouse for $35, I’ll buy at least one. Two will do me for another 6 years, I expect.
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mouse, ergonomic form-factor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to accompany my new Surface Pro 128GB, which is my new work laptop/workstation. This mouse is fantastic. It's small size may seem curious and tiny, but it's a GREAT form-factor. The angling of the mouse and where you hold it contour your hand to the exact same position it sits in while holding a "full size" mouse. I was incredibly, pleasantly surprised by this - it is very comfortable to use! The "backpack mode" where it turns off once the device it's paired with is off (or in sleep mode) is also fantastic. Five stars. We will be ordering and deploying these at my company for mobile/tablet users.
customer_reviews.author: aceoforder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little mouse...accentuate little, it a takes a bit of time to get use to its functionality. I bought one and couldn't get it to pair, so I returned it for another which had the same issue. Turns out...the batteries (energizer) that were included, were dead!!
customer_reviews.author: kurt w

customer_reviews.title: It seems to randomly turn on at times, and ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to randomly turn on at times, and drain the battery. It's also difficult to close the battery cover door once you've put in a new battery; you have to hold down the battery against the spring inside as you slide the door shut, and if the battery's pushing against the door at all, it prevents the door from catching the latch. It's very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Pilgrim O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered - remedied my touchpaid lockup problem
customer_reviews.text: The touchpad on my 5 year old Gateway Windows 8 laptop had been locking up, requiring me to continually shut down, restart...etc. Sometimes, it would take a day to get back to normal. Installing Synaptic software would help for a while, then the problem would return. Saw this on Amazon for $35.00 and though I would give it a shot. Works exactly as advertised. Does have a load of features - maybe Microsoft will eventually add more via software updates, but it does all that my touch pad did, except it doesn't lock up. Works very well with Windows 8 Start Page too. Highly recommended, especially if you have a problem like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Neil J. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Junk, stopped working on day 35, only used it a dozen times for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: After 35 days the light came on, but it would not pair. I tried several different tips provided by Microsoft and other users, nothing worked. It's junk. Just out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted about a year before failing completely. Also, constantly found it on in my laptop bag so I removed batter from the mouse every time I traveled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Compact, efficient and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse! I've used the arc touch and then got lost with other devices until I discovered this. At first I thought how is this going to work. It's safely the most intuitive, space efficient and least demanding mouse in my experience. Compact, Bluetooth (no dongle needed) and perfect sensitivity!
customer_reviews.author: Zohare

customer_reviews.title: Well, it *was* a DANDY little mouse, but now it's dead!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I used the mouse perhaps 5 times since buying it (it's my traveler), and it no longer will power on. I have tried two brands of batteries, and no luck. I googled the probllem, and apparently I'm noot alone on this problem with this mouse. PREVIOUS REVIEW: This is a DANDY little mouse! I quickly sync'd it to my laptop, Windows 8 tablet, and my Android phone, and it works great! So far I've used it on my wooden desk, a metal TV tray, my low-pile carpet, and my leg, and I'm very, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy E.

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, affordable bluetooth mouse, great for users on the go with small Windows tablets!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small, Bluetooth mouse. Not a fan of IR/RF mice, and I also wanted this for an 8" tablet that wasn't going to accommodate an adapter, since it only provides MicroUSB. Mouse seems to small to be good, but actually works great. Easy pairing, great battery life, very accurate tracking, and for a Bluetooth mouse, very affordable. I liked the look of their Arc Mouse, and was tempted to go that direction, but the Bluetooth version of that was expensive, so I rolled the dice and got the Wedge. The mouse surface is also touch responsive, so you can scroll web pages with a two finger scroll gesture. Works really well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, boardering on sexy (for a mobile mouse)!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so you want a bluetooth mouse but don't want to have a bulky mouse, well Microsoft you did it right! Small mouse footprint. Easy to set up. After automatic bluetooth configuration it will continue to download the Microsoft software automatically. Use it with the fatter part at the back, thinner in front! Fast response and being 6'3 and large hand it does work okay for me. Why note 5 stars, power button is a little small for these monster hands! If you need a small foot print bluetooth mouse that is Windows 8 ready - this is it!
customer_reviews.author: BorderBuyer_com

customer_reviews.title: Great ultra-portable touch mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works great with my Windows 10 laptop. The multi-touch features works just like Apple's bluetooth multi-touch mouse. Something to be aware of: The actual size of the mouse is really small. Personally, it is only half size of my hand, which is how is suppose to be according to the instruction on the box. This mouse works great when you are doing office work such as using Microsoft Office and web browsing. Yet, it is not a gaming mouse. The left key and right key can not click separately. All in all, this mouse is great for office but not for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Sun

customer_reviews.title: it takes awhile to get used to - doesn't work on kindle fire hd
customer_reviews.text: it's cute, it's small, it pairs easily. however, it is not what i would call ergonomic (when you hold it between your thumb and ring finger, the hard edge rubs on your ring finger). and, it takes awhile to get used to how to scroll...sometimes i find myself just using the up/down arrows on the computer instead. but, overall, it's a great mouse for travel. I had bought it for my dell venue 8 pro (where it's fantastic); I tried to pair it with my kindle fire (though one doesn't really need a mouse with a regular tablet) and it said it wasn't compatible. haven't tried it with my ipad yet.
customer_reviews.author: P. gordon

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, excellent design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool. Everyone who sees it says "What the heck is that?". A mouse. A what? I was looking for a compact Bluetooth mouse for my 2-in-1 travel laptop/tablet. I'm not a youngster so I'm more comfortable with a mouse than a track pad. Bluetooth because I don't want the receiver taking up a valuable USB port. Even though I have large hands I like using this mouse. There are plenty of software controls for adjusting clicking and scrolling. I like that you can scroll in four directions. that's better than my wheeled mouse can do. And it's so compact. Wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: SDW

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop companion
customer_reviews.text: I have not been entirely thrilled with the trackpad on my Lenovo Ideapad so I looked to this guy to ease my pain. Mouse is convenient to pack. You can stick it in your pocket if you are so inclined. Tracking is accurate. It's nice to have the right click button as opposed to Lenovo's double tap gesture right click on the track pad. Mouse comes overly packaged a la apple products and is nice and origami like, but a waste of cardboard if you ask me. Despite the small size of the mouse, it is comfortable to use for my large hands. All in all, very happy with the wedge mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: After using it for 1 month, the battery appeared to be dead so I replaced it. When the new battery did not work, I realized the problem was with the design of the mouse. The battery compartment allows for some movement of the battery and it will suddenly disengage the contacts and lose power. Very frustrating since it works well otherwise and was ideal for travel. I am only 11 days past the 30-day return period.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Compact - perfect for notebooks and tablets
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this mouse. I like that it is Bluetooth - no USB slot consumed, or receiver to loose. This mouse has a tactile click, and senses your intent of the right or left button by your finger position. The whole top moves as one for the tactile click. You can also scroll by moving your finger on the surface of the mouse. The mouse is small - its height makes it easy to pack. You hold the mouse between your thumb and middle finger, so it does not provide a palm rest, but I don't find that a problem. The side slides forward to reveal the hole for the single AA battery, quite clever.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R

customer_reviews.title: I loved. Microsoft hardware is maximum and great brand
customer_reviews.text: All in agreement, I received the product and it is as it appears in the description, of the announcement. I loved. Microsoft hardware is maximum and great brand.Thank you
customer_reviews.author: ronald cueva lucar

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with the bluetooth mouse. I was looking for a relatively inexpensive bluetooth mouse to connect to my fire tv and firestick to control some sideloaded apps. It does its job, I don't have connectivity issues, and for the past month no battery issues. It looks sleek, and is comfortable in the hand. I could see this being very handy for travel with its form factor. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Maria S

customer_reviews.title: Good compact mouse for everyday use as well as travel
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this mouse years ago for use with a small Surface laptop, thinking it would come in handy when travelling because of its compactness. However, I have been using it ever since at home and away and am very comfortable with it.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Grimwood

customer_reviews.title: corroded and dead battery for a mouse advertised as new
customer_reviews.text: packing smashed but mouse seems to have survived that. A little corrosion noticeable on outside of mouse and much more on battery supplied. Mouse paired but but initially I thought it was defective. Turned out to be an almost dead battery. I guess I will keep it as I don't have time to return it before a trip. Presumably the fault is Amazon's poor selling practice, not Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: sanjuandav

customer_reviews.title: but I think it's one of the best portable mice I have ever tried
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this mouse, but I think it's one of the best portable mice I have ever tried. I used to use the Arc mouse but wanted a bluetooth since I didn't want a dongle. This is smaller than I thought, but I'm not upset with that either. I wouldn't recommend for a daily mouse (unless you have much smaller hands than I), but works great when you're at customer sites.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Small and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Having used other bluetooth mice in the past, I really like the size of this one and, importantly, how reliable it is. It always connects to my ultrabook just fine. It has a flaw in the the power button is too easily activated. When it goes in my bag, it just needs a little pressure on the power button to turn it on. It has happened a number of times that I have opened my bag and seen the blue light glowing. Battery usage is really low so it hasn't been a big issue. The power button probably should have been a slide on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: Brian5

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love the Wedge
customer_reviews.text: I love the wedge mouse for many reasons: High quality product made by Microsoft, Made to work with Windows 8, One wedge mouse can be used on multiple Bluetooth devices & computers, Small & compact so it's easy to take with you (so you do), Long dependable battery life, Works great on any surface (wood, glass, carpet, plastic or metal), high quality Wireless built in Bluetooth technology with no need for secondary HDMI or other plug in device to work. I could go on but the best thing I can say is this is the only mouse I now use. I have donated my old mouse collection to Goodwill. Highly recommend this product & Seller!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but not so useful
customer_reviews.text: The small form factor does not offset comfort or durability. Before my Wedge mysteriously stopped turning on (changed batteries too) during my business trip, my fingers often cramped from extended use. I have had to get hand massages because of this product. I recommend sticking with Apple's Magic Mouse and spending a bit less for something less flashy (e.g. Logitech).
customer_reviews.author: R. HUANG

customer_reviews.title: If you need portability look no further.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is tiny! I could easily fit two of them in the palm of my hand and that is what is so charming about this mouse. It connects to any Bluetooth computer or tablet in a matter of moments and works on practically any surface, including my bed without any pad underneath. I plan on using this for college classes when I'm on the go. I'll admit, it is a little uncomfortable if you have larger hands because it is just so small, but in the end, it is an awesome little piece of tech that clicks, scrolls, and everything else a mouse should do.
customer_reviews.author: originalbonbon

customer_reviews.title: Great little mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great little mouse with no dongle - perfect for travel. Easily paired with my laptop although like the Wedge keyboard it can only pair with one device at a time. I've had a few cases of it pausing as if something is interfering with the Bluetooth signal, but I understand this is probably my wireless adapter and have changed some settings there that have improved things a lot. The touch scrolling is quite sensitive too, but all in I'd recommend this and it gets lots of admiring looks
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ellsom

customer_reviews.title: smallish but very usable mouse
customer_reviews.text: could not get it to work with my hp laptop, the blue tooth is on the laptop but not in a way I could get to it. So will use it on future laptops or whatever in the future, no problem really, It is on the small side, but it would be great for me to flip through the pages as I need to do at times. Thanks for having it, Best wishes for continuance in your business.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Haughn

customer_reviews.title: Should've learned my lesson!!
customer_reviews.text: I owned one before for my Surface a Pro and it died after 4 mos. Went back a Logitech with the USB dongle. Bought another one for my new Dell as it has a USB-C port and Logitech doesn't make a dongle Mouse will not stay connected and lags considerably when it is connected.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Eats through batteries, Bluetooth syncing issues
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if my mouse was defective, but mine seems to eat through batteries really fast. I've had to replace them every month or so. Also, I spend a lot of time re-syncing this device. I don't know if it's my computer or the mouse, but I've gone back to using a USB mouse to avoid the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Sax Man

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects. Scrolls poorly. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is outstanding. Every bit as good as anything from Apple. Comfortable too. It just doesn't work well. It seems to disconnect a couple times a day, and this is when used with a Surface Pro - a Microsoft product. Often, clicks and scrolls get crossed, so click becomes a scroll, then a click, so I often find myself clicking something below what I intended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is nice and small
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is nice and small, however like others have said the center scrolling is just to inconsistent for me. If you are not a center scroll kind of person, this would be a 5 star product. Ultimately going to have to return
customer_reviews.author: adammarinette

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is a great traveling companion.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small Bluetooth mouse for traveling with a Windows based tablet. Despite Microsoft trying to make Windows be a tablet OS there are times with it when you need a mouse for accuracy such as editing Visio and PowerPoint files. This mouse is a great traveling companion.
customer_reviews.author: Wildcat8

customer_reviews.title: Incredible mouse - worth the extra price
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a few bluetooth mouses before deciding on this one. I'm using it with my Android phone, and I needed something small enough to easily fit into a small shoulder bag / "man purse". So here: PROS * Works great. * Connects easily. * Amazingly usable design * Really small CONS * The on-off button could be hidden a bit better. My inadvertently goes on in my shoulder bag from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Greene

customer_reviews.title: Not For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice durable feeling mouse that is the perfect size for travel. It definitely is small and I see some people complain about that, but for me that was not an issue. The issue I have with it is it does not work on glass or fabric. I happen to have a glass desk and sometimes surf or game on the sofa with my Surface so both were deal breakers for me. Needless to say, I will be returning this but for the right person this should be a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Coopergrl

customer_reviews.title: Unique Design but usability is somewhat marginal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for use with my Microsoft Surface Pro. The design is pretty cool and I like the small size and portability but using this mouse tends to tire my hand and wrist more than a full-sized mouse. Another annoyance is that, frequently, just moving the mouse cursor causes the page to scroll. And sometimes when I try to click on a button or link on the screen, the page will scroll causing the button or link to scoot out from under the mouse pointer. I don't know if this is a problem with the mouse or Surface Pro or Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: CliffordG

customer_reviews.title: I Just Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Hello today, I mean it! I just love it! this little wedge mouse is one of the greatest inventions yet! it is smooth, it handles so easily with just a light touch, the right and left clickers work with just a whisper I would recommend my little wedge mouse to everyone and to anyone who may have arthritis on their hands like me and to everyone who doesn't,
customer_reviews.author: DivineFairy

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with mouse
customer_reviews.text: It may be me but is causing a problem. When I shut down and then power back up I need to pair the mouse. Each time That means I need a second mouse to tell it to pair. When I have time I play with it seeing if I can figure it out. So far no luck
customer_reviews.author: John E Adams

customer_reviews.title: Portable & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very portable. It takes a while to get used to, but after a day of use it becomes natural. I use Photoshop daily and work from a PC - and I find it very comfortable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price, nor the time.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about a week and half. Then it started suddenly getting disconnected and would not work. Would delete and re install, for it work for a short period. Then just suddenly would not work at all, even when changing the battery and reinstalling.
customer_reviews.author: Nursetz

customer_reviews.title: Connect quickly
customer_reviews.text: Connect with blue tooth very quickly to lap top. Working on editing is useful with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: John Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Small Slick, but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to compliment my Surface Pro, because the touch pad of the Type Cover was not as sensitive to scroll as I expected. While it is nice and slick, the mouse needs a sold surface to make it works. If you have glass table or clear plastic surface table, it will not work! So, after using it for approximately a week, I upgraded to Logitech T650 - a bigger touch pad with 13 macro and designed for Windows 8. The only drawback of T650 is the toggle (not Bluetooth like the Wedge). Otherwise, it is a lot better point and click device than Wedge.
customer_reviews.author: Sport Freak

customer_reviews.title: Compact mouse; buttons have noisy click and require force to press
customer_reviews.text: Compact and light, the Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse is eminently portable. Yet, it is hampered by buttons that require a fair bit of force to press and are also noisy, the latter attribute making it sub-optimal in a quiet classroom or meeting room.
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: For being so small it feels kind of bulky. I really had to hold onto the sides with my thumb and ring finger because it really didn't glide that smoothly on a surface, which was tiring. I would constantly move the mouse from resting only to have my hand slip over it. Also, the unit I got drained batteries like not other. I much prefer the logitech ultrathin T630 to this one, which looks and feels much better too
customer_reviews.author: CHG enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use but the mouse is so sensitive and scrolls at any moment. I thought maybe I have to get used to it but no this baby likes to scroll. I would have given it 5 stars had I not that issue. Feels great in my hand and very comfortable. Great durable materials. Bought since my last MS bluetooth mouse 5000 finally had a software issue after 2 years of use and would not work. This one is a good one and Amazon had the best price delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse - Connects easily - But...
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse for my Lenovo 8" tablet. Connects easily and the form is very comfortable. But...I've only had it a few short weeks and I'm on battery number 6 already. I don't use the mouse that often. Can't tell if the battery issue is the mouse or the batteries. I've started taking the battery out of the mouse when not in use but they still die within a day or two with very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Coffer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse with a few quirks
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m pleased with the wedge touch mouse. It’s Bluetooth, super small and it works as a mouse + kind-of touchpad. The mouse wheel has been replaced with a touchpad-like area. I can’t say there’s anything wrong with the design or the mouse doesn’t function. It’s just that it’s so small, and sometimes the scrolling part is both too sensitive and not sensitive enough at the same time. Still I use it daily, but I kind of miss the conventional mouse.
customer_reviews.author: D. Deavours

customer_reviews.title: Small, but actually a good mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it's small, but it's actually a really good mouse. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little mouse, not the smallest.
customer_reviews.text: Great little bluetooth mouse, but it's not that small. I bought this to use with my surface pro three, it feels very well made and feels nice in the hand. The buttons are easy to press and the mouse works on most surfaces. It was very easy to connect although the battery it shipped with wasn't working I just put in a new one and everything works well. I'm considering switching this out for the arc mouse, but don't love the idea of keeping track of a USB dongle. This mouse is little but it won't fit snugly in a surface pro 3 sleeve without leaving a bulge.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Good short term usage mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this mouse so far - easy to carry around in a pocket, and bluetooth means no dongle taking up a USB slot. Two things make me hold back from giving it five stars - the pairing procedure isn't documented in the packaging and I had to go to microsoft.com to get the details, and secondly the 'touch' operation isn't perfect. If you need an easily portable mouse to take to meetings from time to time this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Craig

customer_reviews.title: a piece of jewelry
customer_reviews.text: amazing I love it its size is perfect easy to use it it is helpfull in moving and using with imac more than imac's mouse itself I find it like a piece of jewelry it is worthy to have it and use it !perfect
customer_reviews.author: m.I.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe too small for some users
customer_reviews.text: It works well, tracks cleanly and the touchpad scrolling surface is nice. My only problem is that it is just too small for my hand. With my fingers resting on the front edge the back edge doesn't touch my palm unless I close up my hand a bit; very uncomfortable. I think that you're just supposed to rest your fingers on the mouse and move it that way? In any case I'll be getting a larger mouse. I'm too used to having something I can rest my palm on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Used it with my Dell Latitude 10. Does a good job as a tiny mouse. Great industrial design. Can use it on a surface or on your thigh if you are on a plane. There is some ability to use touch scrolling, tho not as good as a full fledged touchpad. But it is small and portable. About the only annoyance is you have to make sure you turn it off when you throw it in your bag, or each time it detects a scroll movement it will wake up your tablet.
customer_reviews.author: MikeG

customer_reviews.title: would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: A nice portable mouse. You can throw it in your pocket and it's not bulky. A little weird to use at first because you're missing a good part of the mouse, but you adjust. For the most part I like MS hardware and this doesn't disappoint. Well made with a little heft. Uses only one battery, but I don't know if it lasts long. Going on about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone, but I like it
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is not for everyone, but I find it very useful. The complaints about size are from people that are just used to a larger mouse in their hand. I normally use a trackpad on my laptop so this mouse is ideal for me. The gestures and scrolling are very good and it is very comfortable in my large hands. I prefer it to the larger form mice and it will fit in my pocket if I have to go to a meeting.
customer_reviews.author: GalvezGuy

customer_reviews.title: Small but not as comfortable to use as the Logitech Ultrathin Touch Mouse T630
customer_reviews.text: Small but not as comfortable to use as the Logitech Ultrathin Touch Mouse T630. The Logitech fits under the palm of the hand better. Also, the Logitech scrolling (using the touch surface) is smoother - it seems the Microsoft touch surface doesn't react consistently across the entire surface, instead some areas are more responsive than others.
customer_reviews.author: Rob & Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for people looking for a small profile
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is quite small. The pictures really do not do it justice. I use it with a Surface Pro and the mouse is recognized instantly unlike many other bluetooth devices I've used in the past. The top is touch sensitive for both horizontal and vertical scrolling. One downside is it will not work on mirrored or glass surfaces so I cannot use it on my coffee table. It has a sleek design and a single AA battery that makes it very portable.
customer_reviews.author: blarbles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel compantion
customer_reviews.text: Have used this with both a laptop and my Blackberry Playbook. It's great. I'm not sure that I'd want to use it at work all day, but for travel use, it's perfect. Put in a Lithium AA battery and it's even lighter. I'm very surprised that it didn't come with some sort of case. I have purchased Microsoft folding travel mice in the past and they have all come with pouches. Not a real issue as I can always re-use one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: great bluetooth mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Great travel mouse, very responsive with a slick design. The only thing I'm struggling with, and this requires a learning curve, is with the right click button, I am used to leave my finger on the right button, that is how I hold the mouse, but that is not how microsoft wants us to use it, specially when you don't need to use it. Admittedly, Microsoft really does good hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Istvan

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love the ergonomics, battery not bad just switch it off when not using. I learned that from my first one, which lasted over 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: SleevSaver

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool, tough to use
customer_reviews.text: Found this mouse really uncomfortable to use - seems like they let the designers create the whole thing without any usability testing. It's well created - it feels 'premium'. But there is no wrist rest, and the touch scrolling didn't work well - overall it just looked a lot better than it worked!
customer_reviews.author: TJW

customer_reviews.title: Cool mouse
customer_reviews.text: Cool little mouse that works great for travel. Works on Bluetooth so no dongle is needed. Paired with my Microsoft Surface in seconds and always works. Haven't had trouble on any mouse surfaces. It shuts off automatically and I have not had to replace the battery yet after months of use. It is very small though so very large hands might not like it.
customer_reviews.author: RogersJim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Microsoft Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am still using it – I personally recommend this to friend and family
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv Dhiman

customer_reviews.title: Bit of an Adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting use to but it works well for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Kintana

customer_reviews.title: BAD DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use this mouse. I find the scroll function very poor. I don't know whether it is because of a blue tooth delay or something else but my wedge mouse does not seem quick enough in response to scrolling. Why bother to move the touch scrolling from the tablet to the mouse? It works better on the tablet. As a pointing device, it works fine. It's probably just me but I don't like it. For anybody considering purchasing it, I recommend trying it first.
customer_reviews.author: Mason B. Yeaton

customer_reviews.title: Usable if you don't scroll
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like it but the scrolling stutters and is quite unreliable compared to other wireless mice and even compared to gesture scrolling on my laptop's trackpad it's pretty bad. Also didn't like that there's no option to change the function of the left and right scrolling like you can with most Logitech mice.
customer_reviews.author: Stuck in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a Little Small
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is really well designed and different than other wireless devices I have used. The Bluetooth feature is nice because I hate losing my USB port. It is on the smaller side and while I have gotten used to it, I do find myself wishing I had a more full size mouse some of the time. That being said I do not regret the purchase because of its portability, unique design and great functionality are better than most.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Works for big hands
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands, with long fingers. I have had trouble trying to use a small mouse in the past. Based on the other reviewers comments I took a chance. Glad I did. It is great. I grasp it between my thumb and the inside of my little finger. It is perfect for traveling. I even tried it on my Asus Transformer Android pad and it connected right up and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: TedW

customer_reviews.title: One Slick, Sick, BEAUTIFUL piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: Recently, I bought a MS Surface Pro. I really love it. However, the touch/feel on the Type Keyboard touchpad - especially the "mouse keys" - left a little to be desired. I LOVE this Wedge Mouse. It has really helped me to enjoy the Surface much, much more. It took all of 30 seconds to open the box, put the battery in, and get the mouse up and running. I love it's size (travels really well) and ergonomic feel. Really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Icthus

customer_reviews.title: It does take a bit of work to get our IT department to get the bluetooth connected but once sync'd it works great. Battery life could be just a bit better
customer_reviews.text: This is the only mouse my manager will use. It does take a bit of work to get our IT department to get the bluetooth connected but once sync'd it works great. Battery life could be just a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: P. Frick

customer_reviews.title: touch mouse with limited functionality
customer_reviews.text: First, it appears that left and right on this mouse, has the same function as up and down. The functionality is poor as there is not even a middle mouse button equivalent on it. The right click is difficult as if your finger gets close to the edge, it does not right click. With a tiny mouse, that happens often. I cannot imagine where this would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: tbm

customer_reviews.title: Design over function
customer_reviews.text: Despite my finger to the right of the middle line, I would often get left-clicks instead of right-clicks. I'm fairly sure this is due to the unibody constructio of the shell. The touch scrolling was nice, but not nearly as refined as the scrolling on a smart phone or touch screen. To make this mouse properly it would end up costing as much as Apple's touch mouse. It's also a bit too wide for it's odd shape. Ambitious, but ultimately mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Sourshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mouse for laptop or Surface device, especially if you have small hands. The set up took literally one minute, it is easy to turn off and has very long battery life. It does take a bit of practice to learn to use the scroll function, which works differently than common mice with the scroll wheel. The only improvement would be to have a protective case included.
customer_reviews.author: EANoble

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for Convenience Purposes Only
customer_reviews.text: I brought this blue tooth mouse to use with my Surface Pro 2 and it does the job. Very small and light so fits easily into any pockets to take from meeting to meeting if you don't want to carry a satchel or computer bag around. Would give it a five but it has no extra mouse features for going back to previous page, etc., and no windows 8 gestures, just a basic mouse with horizontal and vertical scrolling. I would only suggest buying this mouse if your looking for the convenience factor to have something small to carry around. If your looking for a desktop mouse go with something with more features for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: mmoore4249

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the deal is. Had the solid black one at first and it worked perfect. This one is just not working and it is very frustrated. Left clicks result in right clicks. The only way to get a right click is push both buttons at the same time which is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Thrash54

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth i have used.
customer_reviews.text: The best mouse i have used so far. Solid connection and light weight. It is cery low on power consumption and is very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Joewzu

customer_reviews.title: Something from Microsoft that really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the size and shape, one might assume design trumped ergonomics. But, it fits in the hand, works as it's supposed and looks so damn cool on your desk. On-off switch is not 100% right, but battery seems to last forever, so who cares? If only Windows was designed with such simple, functional elegance.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burdick

customer_reviews.title: A little small with quality issues
customer_reviews.text: My hands are not that big and using the mouse was uncomfortable. I understand that MS was going for a very small footprint, but it just didn't work for me. In addition to my personal dislike of the shape and size (it could work for you though), there was a wobble. The whole mouse rocked when pressing the left click and initially, I thought this was just part of the design. But, upon further inspection, it rocked because the bottom slide rails were just not set correctly. Kudos to MS for trying something new with the mouse, but I found it to not be that successful in both design as well as build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Surface only mouse
customer_reviews.text: I liked the side to side scrolling. It was not a great fit in my hand. It did not work seamlessly with computers other than the Surface. On the Surface it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Browne

customer_reviews.title: Wedge Mouse looks better than it performs
customer_reviews.text: This gizmo is sensitive to the surface it is on... much more than other optical mice I've used. I notice it uses a blue laser... not the common red type... so I'm apt to attribute this weakness to the laser type. It seems to work best on monochromatic or plain / dull surfaces. On more reflective surfaces like marble tops and things like cloth tabletops with patterns, the Wedge just doesn't track well.
customer_reviews.author: AOei

customer_reviews.title: Lost connection
customer_reviews.text: I have a sensitive right wrist. Thought a small mouse as this one would do the trick. It kind of does... But as some people have mentioned, it does loose connectivity ;(
customer_reviews.author: Dr. BuBu

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is very sleek and compact. I like that it is bluetooth so you do not need to take up a USB hub. It works on a lot more surfaces than my old wireless mouse. It is touch sensitive so you can scroll up and down much like a touch pad on a laptop. Cons: a little small if you have large hands, and no mouse wheel click (that I have found so far).
customer_reviews.author: uclabruin24

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it's okay.
customer_reviews.text: I find myself using it a lot surprisingly. It's small, connects fast via Bluetooth, and frees up my only USB port on my surface pro. Decent "on the go" accessory. The scroll features are a bit finicky with some apps, but works just fine on most. When it doesn't though, it's frustrating naturally. IDK if it's the mouse drivers, or the software I'm using being semi-incompatible with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: I bought two
customer_reviews.text: I use one for my laptop I bought a cool case for and one for my desktop and I love them alot. I have a tiny Bluetooth lag sometimes but I think it's a power setting I need to turn off. GREAT item for the price 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Lexo

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job but not for everybody
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Portable and light weight Accurate on almost all surfaces Connects instantly with stable connection most of the time Well constructed, feels and looks good Con's Becomes uncomfortable after awhile Touch scrolling somewhat jerky and stuttery at times Right or left click input can be hit or miss sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Angelo T.

customer_reviews.title: as many others have noted it works great at first but then after a few months it ...
customer_reviews.text: as many others have noted it works great at first but then after a few months it starts flickering and cuts on and off. If you are having problems try making sure your power management isn't turning off your Bluetooth connection. But even with that fix I was still loosing connection (and when I flip the mouse over I can see the tracking light flickering on and off). Very portable and easy to use otherwise. Just wish it lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Hakim

customer_reviews.title: 2 days and it broke
customer_reviews.text: The title of my review says enough, however, if you need a super-portable mouse and only plan to use it for 1 hour sessions only...this may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cox

product_meta.title: Microsoft Wedge Touch Mouse
product_meta.description:
Offers Ultimate Portability. The stylish, minimalist design of the Wedge Touch Mouse will allow you to be productive anytime, anywhere. It is optimized for Windows 8 navigation, works with most tablets and laptops, has wireless Bluetooth connectivity, and Blue Track technology for using on virtually any surface.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT WEDGE TOUCH MOUSE
Compact for ultimate portability OFFERS ULTIMATE PORTABILITY
The stylish, minimalist design of the Wedge Touch Mouse will allow you to be productive anytime, anywhere in Windows 7 and Windows 8. Wedge Touch Mouse works great with Windows 8 and the new horizontal scrolling experience on the Start Screen and in documents.

Wedge Touch Mouse features a touch sensitive surface that responds to one finger touches differently depending on where they contact the surface. Stroke with one finger vertically or horizontally to scroll. Press your left finger for "Left click". Press your right finger, while slightly lifting your left finger, for "Right click".

Wedge Touch Mouse is the perfect companion for your laptop or Windows 8 tablet when you're on the go.

BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY MEANS NO CLUTTER
Not only is Wedge Touch Mouse compact, it doesn't come with cables or USB transceivers. Just turn it on and connect it to your Bluetooth-enabled laptop or tablet. Additionally, BlueTrack technology means it tracks on virtually any surface, whether you're at a conference or a coffee shop.

CONSERVES BATTERY POWER
Wedge Touch Mouse even knows how to conserve energy. When your PC or tablet is shut down or hibernating, the mouse goes into "Backpack Mode." You can throw it into your bag and not worry if you turned it off because it senses that it no longer needs to be on.




FOUR-WAY TOUCH SCROLLING
 * Scroll vertically AND horizontally
 * Flick up, down, and side to side to navigate
 * Scroll slowly with a gentle swipe
 * Scroll quickly with a flick of the finger, then tap to stop


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Compact design for ultimate portability
 * 4-way touch scrolling for navigating up, down, left and right
 * Works on virtually any surface with BlueTrack Technology
 * Wireless Bluetooth connectivity - no transceiver required
 * Optimized for Windows 8 navigation
 * Works with many Android tablets


*Advanced functionality not available with all devices. See compatibility information.

*BlueTrack Technology does not work on clear glass or mirrored surfaces.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Computer/Operating System
   Windows 8, Windows RT, Windows 7
 * Hard Drive
   150 MB
 * Other
   1 AA alkaline battery (included)
